name: Dan Boutique Jerusalem

reviews.text: It's quite a hike to old city, be prepared for a hot walk, down a highway, not much around hotel but it's a nice place to stay, good design, service and free WI FI in the Lobby, a rarity in Israel.
reviews.title: A nice hotel a little too far from action..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location, comfort and price all come together at the Dan Boutique.
reviews.title: Great views and comfortable stay
friendly and clean
reviews.text: Location: 10-15 minute walk to the Jaffa gate, so it's easy to get to the Old City. An assortment of restaurants are in the general area.

reviews.title: Ehhhh.
reviews.text: Comfort: We had room 520 on the top floor at the end of the hall. It was quiet, had a comfortably firm mattress, and a great view of the old city. The room itself was on the small side as was the bathroom, but it was fine. A stand-out was coming back at night, opening the curtains and seeing the lights of the old city. Fantastic!

The breakfast buffet had a reasonably large selection. When I asked for fresh mint for teac, there was no problem and it appeared from the kitchen in a few minutes. Other than breakfast, we didn't use any other services of the hotel so I can't comment on anything else.
reviews.title: Surprisingly modern, decent rooms and a good breakfast

reviews.text: Modern hotel with small and comfortable rooms. Breakfast, service and location are excellent. The hotel is close to the old city and you can find pretty good restaurants in the area. Wi-fi zone free in the lobby.
reviews.title: Modern hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice and modern hotel.
reviews.title: A short vacation

reviews.text: The room is small but comfortable, with lots of storage space.
reviews.title: This has been a good selection.

reviews.text: The bathroom is not renewed, definitely needs one.

reviews.text: the size is perfect - intimate and interesting - food was very well done - we had a great breakfast there every day
reviews.title: location and service hallmarks

reviews.text: locatin is terrific as it is walking distance to old city
reviews.title: Nice place to stay

reviews.text: clean, well designed, intimate, great service
reviews.title: A good place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: it's a great landing place for this historic city
reviews.title: Good stay in a great city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second stay at the Dan Boutique. The staff is friendly and helpful; the room was clean and comfortable. We loved the fresh food at breakfast and became especially partial to the cappuccino makers. Although the breakfasts lacked variety, the food was consistently good. The bar area is a great place to socialize and use the free wi-fi. There is a great view from the 3rd floor viewing deck. Located within walking distance of the Old City and the German Colony, the hotel is nicely situated. We will definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: It was nice to be back at the Dan Boutique.
Reliable Staff, Excellent Breakfast, Good Location
reviews.text: We had a top floor (5 - but ground floor is 0 so it's really 6) suite with full bath plus half bath. Sofa was made up for a bed when we arrived, a great touch that Embassy Suites & other USA suite hotels should learn. Breakfast is wonderful from the breads to fruits and salads (yes, there's fish, eggs, cheese, and dairy but we're vegetarian and vegan). Service is relaxed in a good way and friendly. I left my iPad at the bar and there were layers of security to retrieve it from security, including ID and paper signing - excellent system! Amit at the front desk, as well as the women training with him, are as good as it gets (I hope I correctly remember his name). The view from the suite rooms is beautiful and the windows open to enjoy August's cool night air (as well as street noise including the Ramadan call to prayer). We noticed many America guests among French, Mexican, and other nationalities. Jacof the taxi driver tries to be friendly; he drove us to the airport. The walk to the German Colony is a delight. King David Street past parks is always an easy walk. We stocked the refrigerator with fruit, water, and beer from the nearby store, and enjoyed drinks from the hotel bar as we used free Internet in the lobby. Dan is classy and the Boutique was an enjoyable stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the second time my wife and I stay in this hotel. It is located in a good location in Jerusalem, a few minutes walk from the old city.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.text: The service and the hotel it self is impeccable. Food is great.
reviews.title: A nice stay

reviews.text: It's a small and cozy hotel.
reviews.title: good hotel for a price

reviews.text: Prices are very reasonable for a Boutique hotel.
reviews.title: quiet, not central

description: Stylish hotel located opposite Mt Zion and the Old City of Jerusalem, within easy reach of many tourist attractions. The spacious, contemporary guest rooms and suites offer every modern comfort along with state-of-he-art technology. The exquisite interior design skillfully combines eastern and western motifs to create a warm and soothing atmosphere. The guest rooms boast stunning views of Jerusalem’s cityscape, Old City and Mount Zion.
